channel.title: Form Data :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Form data is simply serialized key/value pairs pulled from a form and encoded using one of the three possible encoding strategies, and submitted using the specified method (usually GET or POST). So when we submit a form containing two text inputs for first and last name: <form method="post"> <label for="First">First Name:</label> <input type="text" name="First"/> <label for="Last">Last Name:</label> <input type="text" name="Last"/> <input type="Submit" value="Save Name"/> </form>And enter the values “Frank” and “Jones”, the form is serialized as the key-value pairs:
